intro: Valeriana amurensis f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the Amur valerian, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, small white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The root system is fibrous and contains compounds used in traditional medicine.
